Law.name: Dublin Regulation
Law.description: EU law determining the responsible state for asylum applications, establishing criteria and mechanisms for determining which country is responsible for examining an asylum application.

Law.name: Regulation (EU) No 604/2013
Law.description: Criteria and mechanisms for determining the responsible Member State for examining asylum applications in the EU.

Law.name: Directive 2003/9/EC
Law.description: EU directive establishing minimum standards for the reception of asylum seekers in Member States.

Law.name: Directive 2013/33/EU
Law.description: EU directive laying down standards for the reception of applicants for international protection.

Law.name: Directive 2008/115/EU
Law.description: EU directive on common standards and procedures in Member States for returning illegally staying third-country nationals.

Law.name: Directive 2011/33/EU
Law.description: EU directive amending Directive 2003/109/EC to extend its scope to beneficiaries of international protection.

Law.name: Law of September 10, 2018
Law.description: French law introducing new grounds for the loss of the right to stay and extending the grounds for detention and house arrest of asylum seekers.

Law.name: Article L. 711-1 CESEDA
Law.description: French law granting constitutional asylum to individuals persecuted for their actions in favor of freedom.

Law.name: Article L. 542-4 CESEDA
Law.description: French law mandating that individuals whose asylum application has been definitively rejected must leave French territory under threat of an expulsion measure.

Law.name: Law of January 26, 2024
Law.description: French law making it compulsory to issue an expulsion order (OQTF) if an asylum application is definitively rejected.

Law.name: Law of July 6, 1989
Law.description: French law protecting tenants against discriminatory refusals of rental.

Law.name: French Penal Code Article 132-77
Law.description: French penal code establishing that crimes committed due to the victim's gender, sexual orientation, or gender identity are aggravating circumstances.

Law.name: French Penal Code Article 225-4-13
Law.description: French penal code criminalizing conversion therapy practices aimed at changing or suppressing a person's sexual orientation or gender identity.

Law.name: Directive 2003/109/EC
Law.description: EU directive concerning the status of third-country nationals who are long-term residents.

Law.name: Regulation (EU) No 439/2010
Law.description: EU regulation establishing the European Asylum Support Office (EASO).

Law.name: French Civil Code Article L. 371-1
Law.description: French civil code defining parental authority as a set of rights and duties aimed at the interest of the child.

Law.name: French Civil Code Article 22-1
Law.description: French civil code article related to the conditions under which a guarantor may unilaterally terminate a surety agreement.

Law.name: Law of July 29, 1881
Law.description: French law on the freedom of the press, addressing offenses such as public insults and defamation.

Law.name: Article L. 542-2 CESEDA
Law.description: French law listing the reasons for loss of the right to stay and the conditions for detention or house arrest of asylum seekers.

Law.name: Article L. 753-1 CESEDA
Law.description: French law allowing individuals subject to a deportation order to request the suspension of the execution of the measure within 48 hours of notification.

Law.name: French Penal Code Article 225-1
Law.description: French penal code prohibiting discrimination based on origin, name, physical appearance, sex, family situation, and other characteristics.

Law.name: French Penal Code Article 225-2
Law.description: French penal code outlining penalties for acts of discrimination, including imprisonment and fines.

Law.name: French Penal Code Article 225-3
Law.description: French penal code addressing discrimination in the refusal to provide services or benefits based on prohibited characteristics.

Law.name: French Penal Code Article 225-4
Law.description: French penal code providing legal protections against discrimination in housing, employment, and public services.

Law.name: European Convention on Human Rights
Law.description: An international treaty to protect human rights and fundamental freedoms in Europe.

Law.name: French Civil Code Article 16
Law.description: French civil code article concerning the protection of the human body and human dignity.

Law.name: Law of January 6, 1978
Law.description: French law on data protection, known as the Data Protection Act (Loi Informatique et Libert√©s).

Law.name: French Constitution Article 66
Law.description: Article of the French Constitution ensuring that no one shall be arbitrarily detained.

Law.name: Geneva Convention
Law.description: International treaty establishing standards for the treatment of refugees, including the rights and protections afforded to them.

Law.name: Universal Declaration of Human Rights
Law.description: A foundational international document outlining the rights and freedoms to which all human beings are entitled.

Law.name: UN Convention Against Torture
Law.description: International treaty aiming to prevent torture and other cruel, inhuman, or degrading treatment or punishment.

Law.name: UN Convention on the Rights of the Child
Law.description: International treaty outlining the civil, political, economic, social, and cultural rights of children.

Law.name: International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights
Law.description: International treaty committing its parties to respect the civil and political rights of individuals.

Law.name: International Covenant on Economic, Social and Cultural Rights
Law.description: International treaty ensuring the protection of economic, social, and cultural rights.

Law.name: Rome Statute
Law.description: The treaty that established the International Criminal Court (ICC) to prosecute individuals for genocide, crimes against humanity, and war crimes.

Law.name: Law of December 31, 1971
Law.description: French law on the organization and functioning of the legal profession.

Law.name: Directive 2011/36/EU
Law.description: EU directive on preventing and combating trafficking in human beings and protecting its victims.

Law.name: French Law on Asylum 2015
Law.description: French law reforming the asylum procedure, including the rights and obligations of asylum seekers.

Law.name: Law on Foreigners' Rights 2018
Law.description: French law introducing new measures on the rights of foreigners, including changes to the asylum procedure.

Law.name: Charter of Fundamental Rights of the European Union
Law.description: EU document enshrining the fundamental rights and freedoms of individuals within the European Union.

Law.name: French Labour Code Article L. 1221-1
Law.description: French labor code article outlining the general principles of employment contracts.

Law.name: French Penal Code Article 221-1
Law.description: French penal code article defining the crime of murder and the applicable penalties.

Law.name: French Penal Code Article 222-1
Law.description: French penal code article addressing acts of violence leading to death without intent to kill.

Law.name: French Penal Code Article 225-5
Law.description: French penal code article addressing human trafficking and exploitation.

Law.name: French Penal Code Article 223-6
Law.description: French penal code article on the duty to assist a person in danger.

Law.name: French Penal Code Article 322-1
Law.description: French penal code article addressing the crime of arson and its penalties.

Law.name: French Penal Code Article 431-1
Law.description: French penal code article on the protection of public order and the penalties for public disturbances.
